name: pulpy
content:
pulpy adjective
(SOFT AND WET)
Add to word list
Add to word list
feeling or looking like a soft wet mass, often with fibres (= thin threads) in it: He pounded the roots and stems into a pulpy mush. The brown pulpy residue is about half wood fibre and half lime and grit.
More examplesFewer examplesThe trees had been hacked into a pulpy mess.Once on a host tree, the mold wreaks havoc on the pulpy flesh beneath the bark.Brazil has an excess of bagasse, the dry pulpy residue left after the extraction of juice from sugar cane.

pulpy adjective
(OF LOW QUALITY)
(of books, magazines, plays, etc.) of low quality in the way they are produced and containing stories that are intended to be shocking rather than serious: The original book was pulpy and trashy. It's a reminder of how soapy and pulpy most of her films were.
More examplesFewer examplesPreston enjoyed this pulpy book about Ebola.Plays don't come much pulpier than "Made in China". From its pulpy beginnings, "Kramer's Ergot" has evolved into a showcase of art by mostly younger comic artists.
